sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: BuzzFeed Taps Taboola's DeeperDive AI To Power Asia Sites
feed.summary: BuzzFeed Asia is partnering with Taboola to integrate its DeeperDive generative AI answer engine across its sites in Singapore, Malaysia, and the Philippines. This tool will allow readers to ask questions and receive instant answers from BuzzFeed's content, while also suggesting related articles to keep users engaged. The partnership aims to strengthen BuzzFeed's direct relationship with its readers and create new monetization opportunities through high-intent ads within AI-generated responses.

feed.title: BuzzFeed, Inc. Reports Q3 2025 Results
feed.summary: BuzzFeed, Inc. announced its financial results for Q3 2025, reporting total revenue of $46.3 million, a 17% decrease year-over-year, and a net loss from continuing operations of $7.4 million. Despite the challenging quarter, the company highlighted progress in traffic diversification and audience engagement, particularly with Gen Z and Millennial demographics. BuzzFeed also updated its full-year 2025 financial outlook, projecting revenue between $185 million and $195 million and Adjusted EBITDA ranging from break-even to $10 million.

feed.title: I Teach A College Course On Porn. The Response Has Been Eye-Opening. - HuffPost
feed.summary: Jenn Pollitt, Ph.D., an assistant professor at Temple University, launched a college course on porn in January 2023 with the goal of fostering open conversations about sex and sexuality to heal social divisions. The course, "Social Perspectives in Digital Pornography: The Other Sex Education," examines the history and impact of porn on various aspects of life, focusing on an objective, evidence-based approach rather than viewing explicit content. Pollitt emphasizes that the course helps students confront their feelings about porn, overcome shame, and build empathy and a sense of shared humanity.

feed.title: 32 Of The Best Gym Bags For Carrying *All* Your Stuff
feed.summary: This article reviews 32 of the best gym bags available on the market, ranging from large duffels to compact backpacks and specialty bags for yoga or tennis. It highlights various features like shoe compartments, wet/dry sections, and water resistance, drawing on customer reviews to showcase their utility and appeal for different needs and activities.

feed.title: BuzzFeed, Inc. to Release Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results on Thursday, November 6, 2025 - MarketScreener
feed.summary: BuzzFeed, Inc. announced it will release its third-quarter 2025 financial results on Thursday, November 6, 2025, after the market closes. Founder and CEO Jonah Peretti and CFO Matt Omer will host a conference call to discuss the results at 5:00 PM ET / 2:00 PM PT. The announcement includes details on how interested parties can register for and access the conference call and replay.

feed.title: Marcela Martin Is Stepping Down As Buzzfeed President 01/03/2024 - MediaPost
feed.summary: Marcela Martin has resigned as president of Buzzfeed, effective January 12, with her responsibilities being absorbed by the CEO and management team. Although not entitled to severance, she will receive accelerated vesting of 235,920 stock units. This news comes as Buzzfeed is reportedly close to selling its Complex Networks business for less than anticipated and may need to sell more assets to cover upcoming debts.

feed.title: BuzzFeed, Inc. Secures $40 Million Loan
feed.summary: BuzzFeed, Inc. has secured a new $40 million term loan from Sound Point Agency LLC, which will provide greater financial flexibility, simplify its capital structure, and support strategic initiatives. The company plans to use the proceeds to eliminate all outstanding convertible debt and to purchase 1,826,845 shares of its Class A common stock from a single shareholder. This move aims to enhance BuzzFeed’s capital position and accelerate its focus on long-term growth and financial discipline.

feed.title: BuzzFeed Inc. investor Patrick Kerins sells $96,221 in stock By Investing.com
feed.summary: Patrick J. Kerins, a significant investor in BuzzFeed, Inc. (NASDAQ: BZFD), sold shares totaling $96,221 in two separate transactions in March 2025. These sales occurred as BuzzFeed navigates financial challenges, including a weak financial health score and significant debt burden. The company is actively pursuing strategies such as asset sales, workforce reductions, and executive incentives to adapt to market conditions and improve its financial standing.

feed.title: BuzzFeed, Inc. Announces Sale of First We Feast to an Affiliate of Soros Fund Management in $82.5 Million All-Cash Deal
feed.summary: BuzzFeed, Inc. announced the sale of its First We Feast brand to an affiliate of Soros Fund Management for $82.5 million in an all-cash deal. This divestiture allows BuzzFeed to focus on high-margin, tech-enabled revenue lines like programmatic advertising and affiliate commerce, reinforcing its strategic shift towards an AI-powered media company. The transaction has significantly reduced the company's debt, leaving it with a cash balance that exceeds its remaining debt.

feed.title: BuzzFeed, Inc. Announces Sale Of First We Feast To An Affiliate Of Soros Fund Management In $82.5 Million All-Cash Deal
feed.summary: BuzzFeed, Inc. announced the sale of First We Feast to an affiliate of Soros Fund Management LLC for $82.5 million in an all-cash deal. This transaction, combined with a partial prepayment of outstanding convertible notes, leaves BuzzFeed with a cash balance exceeding its remaining debt. The sale completes BuzzFeed's strategic shift away from lower-margin content towards high-margin, tech-enabled revenue lines like programmatic advertising and affiliate commerce, with a focus on AI-powered interactive experiences.

feed.title: BuzzFeed $9 Million Facebook Settlement: Can You Claim?
feed.summary: BuzzFeed is facing a class-action lawsuit for allegedly sharing user data with Facebook without consent, leading to a proposed $9 million settlement. Users who watched videos on BuzzFeed, HuffPost, Tasty, or Complex websites between May 16, 2021, and November 10, 2023, and were account holders or newsletter subscribers, may be eligible to claim an $8 payment and a free one-year BuzzFeed+ subscription. The deadline to file a claim is November 5th.

feed.title: N/A
feed.summary: A $9 million BuzzFeed settlement has been reached to resolve claims that the website shared user information with Facebook in violation of federal privacy laws, specifically the Video Privacy Protection Act (VPPA). Eligible class members, who include BuzzFeed account holders or digital newsletter subscribers who accessed videos on Buzzfeed-affiliated sites between May 16, 2021, and Nov. 10, 2023, may receive up to $8 and a one-year subscription to BuzzFeed+. The deadline to submit a claim form is November 5, 2024.

feed.title: Vivek Ramaswamy spent $3.3 million to buy 8% of BuzzFeed. How much damage could he do with that stake?
feed.summary: Vivek Ramaswamy recently acquired an 8% stake in BuzzFeed for $3.3 million, making him the fourth-largest shareholder of its class A shares. While a significant stake, BuzzFeed's dual-class stock structure and the majority control held by CEO Jonah Peretti may limit his influence. Ramaswamy's history as an activist investor suggests he intends to push for strategic changes despite the company's structure designed to protect its editorial integrity from such interventions.

feed.title: Vivek Ramaswamy Invests In Buzzfeed—And Share Price Jumps
feed.summary: Entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy has acquired nearly 3 million shares of Buzzfeed, amounting to a 7.7% stake and making him the fourth largest investor in the struggling media company. This news caused Buzzfeed's share price to jump significantly. Ramaswamy believes Buzzfeed is undervalued and plans to discuss operational and strategic opportunities to maximize shareholder value.

feed.title: BuzzFeed CEO moves to majority stock based compensation amid AI push
feed.summary: BuzzFeed CEO Jonah Peretti's compensation will now be predominantly in stock options, aiming to incentivize a turnaround driven by artificial intelligence. The move includes a significant reduction in his base salary, replaced by options to purchase 414,000 shares. This strategy extends to other senior executives as the company bets on AI to boost growth following a tough period in the digital ad market.

feed.title: BuzzFeed, Inc. Announces 1-For-4 Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: BuzzFeed, Inc. announced a 1-for-4 reverse stock split for its Class A and Class B common stock, effective May 6, 2024. This move is intended to increase the bid price of the company's Class A common stock to comply with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. The reverse split will uniformly affect all stockholders, proportionally adjusting outstanding warrants, options, RSUs, and convertible notes.

feed.title: Why Comcast Sold 5.7 Million BuzzFeed Shares
feed.summary: Comcast sold over 5.7 million shares of BuzzFeed as the digital media company's stock jumped due to investor excitement surrounding its artificial intelligence-focused deals with Meta and OpenAI. These sales occurred between January 30 and February 1, with shares trading between $2.15 and $3.465, following BuzzFeed's announcement to integrate OpenAI's technology and a content deal with Meta. Despite the sales, Comcast's NBCUniversal unit still retains a significant stake of 19.97 percent in BuzzFeed.

feed.title: Comcast sells nearly 6 million shares of its Buzzfeed stake amid sharp rally
feed.summary: Comcast Corp. has sold a significant portion of its stake in Buzzfeed Inc., divesting 5,726,385 shares in the open market between January 30 and February 1. This comes as Buzzfeed's shares have surged due to investor excitement over the publisher's artificial intelligence initiatives, though Comcast still retains a 19.97% ownership. Comcast originally made an equity investment in Buzzfeed in 2015.

feed.title: BuzzFeed class action alleges company shares subscriber data with Facebook
feed.summary: A class action lawsuit has been filed against BuzzFeed, Inc., alleging that the company shares the personally identifiable information and video browsing histories of its Huffingtonpost.com digital subscribers with Facebook without proper consent. The lawsuit claims that BuzzFeed violates the Video Privacy Protection Act (VPPA) by using the Facebook Pixel to disclose this information and profits from these unauthorized disclosures. The plaintiff seeks to represent a nationwide class and demands a jury trial, declaratory and injunctive relief, and punitive damages.

feed.title: The BuzzFeed SPAC Fiasco Is Only Getting Worse
feed.summary: BuzzFeed's SPAC performance continues to worsen, with shares plummeting by 85% since its December 6 IPO amidst a lawsuit from 91 former and current employees. The lawsuit alleges BuzzFeed botched its public offering, preventing some employees from selling shares while others, including former editor-in-chief Ben Smith, were able to trade easily. The article highlights major oversight in the conversion of stock shares that disproportionately affected former employees who wished to sell, raising suspicions of negligence or intentional mishandling during the SPAC process.

feed.title: How Former BuzzFeed Employees Missed Their Big Payday
feed.summary: Former BuzzFeed employees were unable to sell their Class B stock when the company went public via a SPAC, despite expectations of a large payday. Many were frustrated by what they described as a rushed process and administrative hurdles, including needing to convert Class B shares to Class A shares by printing and signing a document. The stock price dropped significantly in the first week, leading to dashed hopes for windfalls and questions about potential legal action against BuzzFeed.

feed.title: BuzzFeed, Inc. Announces Closing Of Business Combination With 890 5th Avenue Partners, Inc. and Acquisition Of Complex Networks
feed.summary: BuzzFeed, Inc. has announced the completion of its business combination with 890 5th Avenue Partners, Inc. and the acquisition of Complex Networks. The newly formed company, now named BuzzFeed, Inc., will begin trading on Nasdaq under the symbols “BZFD” and “BZFDW” starting Monday, December 6, 2021. This strategic move expands BuzzFeed's digital media portfolio, incorporating Complex Networks' youth entertainment content across various categories.
